description.narrative: Create a network of learning and sharing of protocols and processes to identify solutions, experiment and generate collective intelligence

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 60 developing countries.
1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level. 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses.
Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets.
2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP) 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies
Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning.
3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network. 3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network. 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem.

Output 1: UNDP Country Offices and partners will have increased capability for scanning, sensemaking and experimentation for sustainable development solutions in 60 developing countries.
1.1 Number of new data sources used at Country Office level: 1 source 1.2 Diversity of different data sources used: 2 sources 1.3 Number of sustainable development solutions identified and documented: 10 solutions 1.4 Variety of innovation methods used to test and iterate over the different hypotheses: 0
Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets.
2.1 Learning the Accelerator Lab Network shares with a public audience (outside of UNDP): 1 blog 2.2 Number of lab insights, processes or products which are taken up by governments or other partners: 1% 2.3 Proportion of partners and governments that increase their take up of the innovation methods included in the Accelerator Lab Network suite:9 ministries included the Ministry of research and innovation 2.4 Proportion of UNDP Country Office programming influenced by the Accelerator Lab Network’s work and methodologies: 1%
Output 3: A core global level result will be that a global learning and scaling network is established and functioning.
3.1 Size and density of the network effects among the Accelerator Labs: Youthkonnect relationship with solution safari 3.2 Number of new models, approaches, and insights documented and disseminated throughout the network: 2% sensemaking, Solution mapping 3.3 Engagement of the broader Development ecosystem with published learnings from the Accelerator Lab Network: 4 appearance; 6 outreach session 3.4 Amount of influence the learnings and methods of the Accelerator Lab Networks have on the discourse of the broader Development ecosystem: 1

Output 2: New sustainable development solutions will be scaled at country level as part of UNDP’s country programme and operations, national policy and/or local markets.
